input:
CONVERSATION HISTORY:
[
  "DOCTOR: What brings you in today?",
  "PATIENT: Well, I\u2019m 55, and I\u2019m a guy. Lately, I\u2019ve been feeling really tired all the time, and I don\u2019t have much of an appetite anymore. There\u2019s this dull pain up on the right side of my stomach that\u2019s been there for a while but lately it\u2019s kinda worse. I also feel a bit sick after I eat and I\u2019ve been losing weight without trying. It\u2019s been going on for a couple of months, but it\u2019s gotten a lot worse recently.",
  "DOCTOR: Can you tell me more about when these symptoms first started and how they have changed over the past two months?",
  "PATIENT: It\u2019s been going on for a couple of months, I think \u2014 I started feeling more tired and not wanting to eat much, and the pain shows up sometimes in my upper right belly, but I don\u2019t really know what\u2019s causing it.",
  "DOCTOR: Can you tell me whether the pain is primarily on the right side or if it spreads elsewhere, and have you noticed any yellowing of your skin or eyes, or changes in your stool or urine since these symptoms started?",
  "PATIENT: Uh, I think the pain is mainly on the right side, but I sometimes feel it all over a little. I haven't really noticed my skin turning yellow, but maybe I saw my eyes look some yellow sometimes? I don't know if that\u2019s right.",
  "DOCTOR: You mentioned some occasional yellowing of your eyes, but I understand it might not be very noticeable. Can you tell me if you've noticed any yellow discoloration of your skin or eyes more clearly, or if your urine or stool has changed color at all since your symptoms began?",
  "PATIENT: Yeah, I think my eyes look a little more yellow, but I haven't really looked at my urine or stool much, so I don\u2019t know if they changed.",
  "DOCTOR: Can you tell me if your skin or eyes have turned more yellow than you're comfortable with, and have you noticed any changes in the color of your stool (like it being clay-colored) or urine (darker than usual) since your symptoms started?",
  "PATIENT: No, I haven't really seen my eyes or skin turn more yellow, and I haven't noticed my pee being darker or my poop changing color. I'm just feeling more tired and icky overall.",
  "DOCTOR: Have you noticed any yellowing of your skin or eyes that seems more obvious or persistent than you initially mentioned, and since your symptoms started, have your stool or urine changed color\u2014such as becoming lighter or darker than usual?",
  "PATIENT: Umm, I haven't noticed my skin or eyes turning yellow or anything really different with my stool or urine, at least I don't think so. I haven't paid that much attention to it.",
  "DOCTOR: Have you noticed any yellowing of your eyes or skin that you might not have paid much attention to before, especially when you're in good lighting or when stepping outside?",
  "PATIENT: Um, no, I don't think so. I haven't really looked closely, but I don't think my eyes or skin look yellow.",
  "DOCTOR: Have you noticed any yellowish tint to the whites of your eyes or your skin when you look closely, especially in good light or in a mirror?",
  "PATIENT: Um, I\u2019ve looked a couple of times, and I think my eyes look maybe a little yellowish. It\u2019s not super obvious, but I\u2019ve noticed it when I was in the mirror.",
  "DOCTOR: I understand you mentioned some yellowing of your eyes before, but when you look closely now, have you been able to notice if the whites of your eyes look more yellow than before, or if your skin has taken on a more obvious yellow tint? Additionally, have you or anyone else observed any redness or swelling in your eyes or noticed any changes in the color of your stool or urine lately?",
  "PATIENT: Um, I haven't really looked closely, but I think my eyes still look a little yellow, and I haven\u2019t noticed much change in my skin, I guess. I haven't paid much attention to my urine or stool lately.",
  "DOCTOR: When you look closely at your eyes or skin in a good light or in front of a mirror, do you notice the whites of your eyes or your skin appearing more yellow than before\u2014maybe slightly more than you initially thought\u2014or do you see any changes in the color of your stool or urine, like being lighter or darker than usual?",
  "PATIENT: I don't usually look at my eyes or skin in good light, but I think maybe my eyes look a little more yellow than before. I haven't paid much attention to my stool or urine, honestly.",
  "DOCTOR: When a healthcare provider examines your eyes and skin closely in good light, do they notice any yellow tinting of the whites of your eyes or your skin that you might not have seen yourself before?",
  "PATIENT: Um, I didn\u2019t really notice anything different myself, but I guess I\u2019m not sure what I should be looking for or what it means if there is."
]
